cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move north-northeast across Florida’s Big Bend Thursday night, cross Georgia and the Carolinas on Friday–Saturday, then emerge offshore and track just east of the Mid-Atlantic coast toward New Jersey and southern New England.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Apalachicola (Suwannee River to Mexico Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Marineland FL to South Santee River SC; Hurricane Watch Anclote River to Suwannee River and west of Mexico Beach to Destin FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Suwannee River to Mexico Beach FL; Tropical Storm Warning Anclote River to Suwannee River and west of Mexico Beach to Destin FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from the Florida Big Bend through the Carolinas to the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph, isolated 50 mph) possible Saturday night through Sunday as the center passes east of Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible along the upper Chesapeake Bay and tidal tributaries.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 2–4+ inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts, leading to urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief spin-up tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain-bands; reduced visibilities in heavy rain could disrupt pilotage and cargo handling.
